intro: Spermacoce nana, commonly known as dwarf starling bean, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces small, spherical berries that turn red when mature. Spermacoce nana is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
